summary.long: Job is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job; and that man was blameless, upright, fearing God and turning away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven sons and three daughters were born to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His possessions were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, five hundred female donkeys, and very many servants; and that man was the greatest of all the men of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons used to go and hold a feast in the house of each one on his day, and they would send word and invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of feasting had completed their cycle, Job would send word to them and consecrate them, getting up early in the morning and offering burnt offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said, “Perhaps my sons have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” Job did so continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan also came among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “From where do you come?” Satan answered the Lord and said, “From roaming about on the earth and walking around on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man, fearing God and turning away from evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan answered the Lord, “Does Job fear God for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have You not made a fence around him and his house and all that he has, on every side? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his possessions have increased in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But reach out with Your hand now and touch all that he has; he will certainly curse You to Your face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Satan, “Behold, all that he has is in your power; only do not reach out and put your hand on him.” So Satan departed from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the female donkeys feeding beside them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Sabeans attacked and took them. They also killed the servants with the edge of the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another came and said, “The fire of God fell from heaven and burned up the sheep and the servants and consumed them, and I alone have escaped to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another came and said, “The Chaldeans formed three units and made a raid on the camels and took them, and killed the servants with the edge of the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another also came and said, “Your sons and your daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, a great wind came from across the wilderness and struck the four corners of the house, and it fell on the young people and they died, and I alone have escaped to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job got up, tore his robe, and shaved his head; then he fell to the ground and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said,
“Naked I came from my mother’s womb,
And naked I shall return there.
The Lord gave and the Lord has taken away.
Blessed be the name of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Despite all this, Job did not sin, nor did he blame God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan also came among them to present himself before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Where have you come from?” Then Satan answered the Lord and said, “From roaming about on the earth and walking around on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man fearing God and turning away from evil. And he still holds firm to his integrity, although you incited Me against him to ruin him without cause.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan answered the Lord and said, “Skin for skin! Yes, all that a man has, he will give for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, reach out with Your hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh; he will curse You to Your face!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Satan, “Behold, he is in your power, only spare his life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan went out from the presence of the Lord and struck Job with severe boils from the sole of his foot to the top of his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job took a piece of pottery to scrape himself while he was sitting in the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his wife said to him, “Do you still hold firm your integrity? Curse God and die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to her, “You are speaking as one of the foolish women speaks. Shall we actually accept good from God but not accept adversity?” Despite all this, Job did not sin with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Job’s three friends heard about all this adversity that had come upon him, they came, each one from his own place—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite; and they made an appointment together to come to sympathize with him and comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they looked from a distance and did not recognize him, they raised their voices and wept. And each of them tore his robe, and they threw dust over their heads toward the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down on the ground with him for seven days and seven nights, with no one speaking a word to him, for they saw that his pain was very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“May the day on which I was to be born perish,
As well as the night which said, ‘A boy is conceived.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, may that night be barren;
May no joyful shout enter it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those curse it who curse the day,
Who are prepared to disturb Leviathan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because it did not shut the opening of my mother’s womb,
Or hide trouble from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why did I not die at birth,
Come out of the womb and pass away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why were the knees there in front of me,
And why the breasts, that I would nurse?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now I would have lain down and been quiet;
I would have slept then, I would have been at rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With kings and counselors of the earth,
Who rebuilt ruins for themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or with rulers who had gold,
Who were filling their houses with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or like a miscarriage which is hidden, I would not exist,
As infants that never saw light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the wicked cease from raging,
And there the weary are at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prisoners are at ease together;
They do not hear the voice of the taskmaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The small and the great are there,
And the slave is free from his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why is light given to one burdened with grief,
And life to the bitter of soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who long for death, but there is none,
And dig for it more than for hidden treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who are filled with jubilation,
And rejoice when they find the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden,
And whom God has shut off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my groaning comes at the sight of my food,
And my cries pour out like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what I fear comes upon me,
And what I dread encounters me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am not at ease, nor am I quiet,
And I am not at rest, but turmoil comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If one ventures a word with you, will you become impatient?
But who can refrain from speaking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, you have taught many,
And you have strengthened weak hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your words have helped the stumbling to stand,
And you have strengthened feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now it comes to you, and you are impatient;
It touches you, and you are horrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your fear of God not your confidence,
And the integrity of your ways your hope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Remember now, who ever perished being innocent?
Or where were the upright destroyed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
According to what I have seen, those who plow wrongdoing
And those who sow trouble harvest it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the breath of God they perish,
And by the blast of His anger they come to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The roaring of the lion and the voice of the fierce lion,
And the teeth of the young lions are broken out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lion perishes for lack of prey,
And the cubs of the lioness are scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now a word was brought to me secretly,
And my ear received a whisper of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amid disquieting thoughts from visions of the night,
When deep sleep falls on people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dread came upon me, and trembling,
And made all my bones shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then a spirit passed by my face;
The hair of my flesh stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Can mankind be righteous before God?
Can a man be pure before his Maker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He puts no trust even in His servants;
And He accuses His angels of error.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much more those who live in houses of clay,
Whose foundation is in the dust,
Who are crushed before the moth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Between morning and evening they are broken in pieces;
Unregarded, they perish forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is their tent-cord not pulled out within them?
They die, yet without wisdom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Call now, is there anyone who will answer you?
And to which of the holy ones will you turn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For irritation kills the fool,
And jealousy brings death to the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen the fool taking root,
And I cursed his home immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sons are far from safety,
They are also oppressed at the gate,
And there is no one to save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hungry devour his harvest
And take it to a place of thorns,
And the schemer is eager for their wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For disaster does not come from the dust,
Nor does trouble sprout from the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For man is born for trouble,
As sparks fly upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But as for me, I would seek God,
And I would make my plea before God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who does great and unsearchable things,
Wonders without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives rain on the earth,
And sends water on the fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that He sets on high those who are lowly,
And those who mourn are lifted to safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He frustrates the schemes of the shrewd,
So that their hands cannot attain success.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He captures the wise by their own cleverness,
And the advice of the cunning is quickly thwarted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By day they meet with darkness,
And grope at noon as in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He saves from the sword of their mouth,
And the poor from the hand of the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the helpless has hope,
And injustice has shut its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, happy is the person whom God disciplines,
So do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He inflicts pain, and gives relief;
He wounds, but His hands also heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In six troubles He will save you;
Even in seven, evil will not touch you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In famine He will redeem you from death,
And in war, from the power of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue,
And you will not be afraid of violence when it comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will laugh at violence and hunger,
And you will not be afraid of wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you will be in league with the stones of the field,
And the animals of the field will be at peace with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will know that your tent is secure,
For you will visit your home and have nothing missing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will also know that your descendants will be many,
And your offspring as the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will come to the grave at a ripe age,
Like the stacking of grain in its season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold this; we have investigated it, and so it is.
Hear it, and know for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh if only my grief were actually weighed
And laid in the balances together with my disaster!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For then it would be heavier than the sand of the seas;
For that reason my words have been rash.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Does the wild donkey bray over his grass,
Or does the ox low over his feed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can something tasteless be eaten without salt,
Or is there any taste in the juice of an alkanet plant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul refuses to touch them;
They are like loathsome food to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh, that my request might come to pass,
And that God would grant my hope!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that God would decide to crush me,
That He would let loose His hand and cut me off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is still my comfort,
And I rejoice in unsparing pain,
That I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is my strength, that I should wait?
And what is my end, that I should endure?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is my strength the strength of stones,
Or is my flesh bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it that my help is not within me,
And that a good outcome is driven away from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For the despairing man there should be kindness from his friend;
So that he does not abandon the fear of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My brothers have acted deceitfully like a wadi,
Like the torrents of wadis which drain away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which are darkened because of ice,
And into which the snow melts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they dry up, they vanish;
When it is hot, they disappear from their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The paths of their course wind along,
They go up into wasteland and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The caravans of Tema looked,
The travelers of Sheba hoped for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were put to shame, for they had trusted,
They came there and were humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you have now become such,
You see terrors and are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I said, ‘Give me something,’
Or, ‘Offer a bribe for me from your wealth,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or, ‘Save me from the hand of the enemy,’
Or, ‘Redeem me from the hand of the tyrants’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Teach me, and I will be silent;
And show me how I have done wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How painful are honest words!
But what does your argument prove?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you intend to rebuke my words,
When the words of one in despair belong to the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You would even cast lots for the orphans,
And barter over your friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now please look at me,
And see if I am lying to your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please turn away, let there be no injustice;
Turn away, my righteousness is still in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there injustice on my tongue?
Does my palate not discern disasters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is a person not forced to labor on earth,
And are his days not like the days of a hired worker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a slave pants for the shade,
And as a hired worker who eagerly waits for his wages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I am allotted worthless months,
And nights of trouble are apportioned to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I lie down, I say,
‘When shall I arise?’
But the night continues,
And I am continually tossing until dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh is clothed with maggots and a crust of dirt,
My skin hardens and oozes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle,
And they come to an end without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Remember that my life is a mere breath;
My eye will not see goodness again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye of him who sees me will no longer look at me;
Your eyes will be on me, but I will not exist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a cloud vanishes, it is gone;
In the same way one who goes down to Sheol does not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not return to his house again,
Nor will his place know about him anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Am I the sea, or the sea monster,
That You set a guard over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, ‘My couch will comfort me,
My bed will ease my complaint,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then You frighten me with dreams,
And terrify me by visions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that my soul would choose suffocation,
Death rather than my pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I waste away; I will not live forever.
Leave me alone, for my days are only a breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is man that You exalt him,
And that You are concerned about him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That You examine him every morning
And put him to the test every moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will You never turn Your gaze away from me,
Nor leave me alone until I swallow my spittle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I sinned? What have I done to You,
Watcher of mankind?
Why have You made me Your target,
So that I am a burden to myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then do You not forgive my wrongdoing
And take away my guilt?
For now I will lie down in the dust;
And You will search for me, but I will no longer exist.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you say these things,
And the words of your mouth be a mighty wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does God pervert justice?
Or does the Almighty pervert what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your sons sinned against Him,
Then He turned them over to the power of their wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you will search for God
And implore the compassion of the Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are pure and upright,
Surely now He will stir Himself for you
And restore your righteous estate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though your beginning was insignificant,
Yet your end will increase greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Please inquire of past generations,
And consider the things searched out by their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we are only of yesterday and know nothing,
Because our days on earth are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will they not teach you and tell you,
And bring forth words from their minds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can papyrus grow tall without a marsh?
Can the rushes grow without water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While it is still green and not cut down,
Yet it withers before any other plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So are the paths of all who forget God;
And the hope of the godless will perish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His confidence is fragile,
And his trust is a spider’s web.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He depends on his house, but it does not stand;
He holds on to it, but it does not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He flourishes before the sun,
And his shoots spread out over his garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His roots wrap around a rock pile,
He grasps a house of stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he is removed from his place,
Then it will deny him, saying, ‘I never saw you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, this is the joy of His way;
And out of the dust others will spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God will not reject a person of integrity,
Nor will He help evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will yet fill your mouth with laughter,
And your lips with joyful shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate you will be clothed with shame,
And the tent of the wicked will no longer exist.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In truth I know that this is so;
But how can a person be in the right with God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one wished to dispute with Him,
He could not answer Him once in a thousand times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise in heart and mighty in strength,
Who has defied Him without harm?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who removes the mountains, and they do not know how,
When He overturns them in His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is He who shakes the earth from its place,
And its pillars tremble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who commands the sun not to shine,
And puts a seal on the stars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who alone stretches out the heavens,
And tramples down the waves of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who makes the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades,
And the constellations of the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is He who does great things, the unfathomable,
And wondrous works without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If He were to pass by me, I would not see Him;
Were He to move past me, I would not perceive Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If He were to snatch away, who could restrain Him?
Who could say to Him, ‘What are You doing?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“God will not turn back His anger;
Beneath Him the helpers of Rahab cower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How then can I answer Him,
And choose my words before Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For though I were right, I could not answer;
I would have to implore the mercy of my Judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I called and He answered me,
I could not believe that He was listening to my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He bruises me with a storm
And multiplies my wounds without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not allow me to get my breath,
But He saturates me with bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If it is a matter of power, behold, He is the strong one!
And if it is a matter of justice, who can summon Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I am righteous, my mouth will condemn me;
Though I am guiltless, He will declare me guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
It is all one; therefore I say,
‘He destroys the guiltless and the wicked.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the whip kills suddenly,
He mocks the despair of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Now my days are swifter than a runner;
They flee away, they see no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They slip by like reed boats,
Like an eagle that swoops on its prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I say, ‘I will forget my complaint,
I will put my face in order and be cheerful,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am afraid of all my pains,
I know that You will not acquit me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am guilty,
Why then should I struggle in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I washed myself with snow,
And cleansed my hands with lye,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then You would plunge me into the pit,
And my own clothes would loathe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He is not a man, as I am, that I may answer Him—
That we may go to court together!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no arbitrator between us,
Who can place his hand upon us both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Him remove His rod from me,
And let not the dread of Him terrify me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I would speak and not fear Him;
But I am not like that in myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to God, ‘Do not condemn me;
Let me know why You contend with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it right for You indeed to oppress,
To reject the work of Your hands,
And to look favorably on the plan of the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do You have eyes of flesh?
Or do You see as mankind sees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are Your days like the days of a mortal,
Or Your years like a man’s year,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That You should search for my guilt
And carefully seek my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
According to Your knowledge I am indeed not guilty,
Yet there is no one to save me from Your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Your hands fashioned and made me altogether,
Yet would You destroy me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember that You have made me as clay;
Yet would You turn me into dust again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did You not pour me out like milk,
And curdle me like cheese,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clothe me with skin and flesh,
And intertwine me with bones and tendons?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have granted me life and goodness;
And Your care has guarded my spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet You have concealed these things in Your heart;
I know that this is within You:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have sinned, You will take note of me,
And will not acquit me of my guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I am wicked, woe to me!
But if I am righteous, I dare not lift up my head.
I am full of shame, and conscious of my misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And should my head be high, You would hunt me like a lion;
And You would show Your power against me again.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Why then did You bring me out of the womb?
If only I had died and no eye had seen me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I should have been as though I had not been,
Brought from womb to tomb.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would He not leave my few days alone?
Withdraw from me so that I may have a little cheerfulness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I go—and I shall not return—
To the land of darkness and deep shadow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land of utter gloom like darkness itself,
Of deep shadow without order,
And it shines like darkness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar the Naamathite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shall a multitude of words go unanswered,
And a talkative man be acquitted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall your boasts silence people?
And will you scoff, and no one rebuke?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have said, ‘My teaching is pure,
And I am innocent in your eyes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if only God would speak,
And open His lips against you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And show you the secrets of wisdom!
For sound wisdom has two sides.
Know then that God forgets part of your guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you discover the depths of God?
Can you discover the limits of the Almighty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are as high as the heavens; what can you do?
Deeper than Sheol; what can you know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its measurement is longer than the earth
And broader than the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If He passes by or apprehends people,
Or calls an assembly, who can restrain Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He knows false people,
And He sees injustice without investigating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An idiot will become intelligent
When a wild donkey is born a human.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you would direct your heart rightly
And spread out your hands to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If wrongdoing is in your hand, put it far away,
And do not let malice dwell in your tents;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then, indeed, you could lift up your face without moral blemish,
And you would be firmly established and not fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you would forget your trouble;
Like waters that have passed by, you would remember it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your life would be brighter than noonday;
Darkness would be like the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you would trust, because there is hope;
And you would look around and rest securely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You would lie down and none would disturb you,
And many would flatter you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Truly then you are the people,
And with you wisdom will die!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He who is at ease holds disaster in contempt,
As prepared for those whose feet slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tents of the destroyers prosper,
And those who provoke God are secure,
Whom God brings into their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But just ask the animals, and have them teach you;
And the birds of the sky, and have them tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or speak to the earth, and have it teach you;
And have the fish of the sea tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who among all these does not know
That the hand of the Lord has done this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In whose hand is the life of every living thing,
And the breath of all mankind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the ear not put words to the test,
As the palate tastes its food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is with the aged,
And with long life comes understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wisdom and might are with Him;
Advice and understanding belong to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He tears down, and it cannot be rebuilt;
He imprisons a person, and there is no release.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He restrains the waters, and they dry up;
And He sends them out, and they inundate the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strength and sound wisdom are with Him.
One who goes astray and one who leads astray belong to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes advisers walk barefoot
And makes fools of judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He undoes the binding of kings,
And ties a loincloth around their waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes priests walk barefoot,
And overthrows the secure ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He deprives the trusted ones of speech,
And takes away the discernment of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He pours contempt on nobles,
And loosens the belt of the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He reveals mysteries from the darkness,
And brings the deep darkness into light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes the nations great, then destroys them;
He enlarges the nations, then leads them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He deprives the leaders of the earth’s people of intelligence
And makes them wander in a pathless wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grope in darkness with no light,
And He makes them stagger like a drunken person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, my eye has seen all this,
My ear has heard and understood it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What you know I also know;
I am not inferior to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I would speak to the Almighty,
And I desire to argue with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you smear me with lies;
You are all worthless physicians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that you would be completely silent,
And that it would become your wisdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please hear my argument,
And give your attention to the contentions of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you speak what is unjust for God,
And speak what is deceitful for Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you show partiality for Him?
Will you contend for God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will it go well when He examines you?
Or will you deceive Him as one deceives a man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will certainly punish you
If you secretly show partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will His majesty not terrify you,
And the dread of Him fall upon you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes,
Your defenses are defenses of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be silent before me so that I may speak;
Then let come upon me what may.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I take my flesh in my teeth,
And put my life in my hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though He slay me,
I will hope in Him.
Nevertheless I will argue my ways before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also will be my salvation,
For a godless person cannot come before His presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen carefully to my speech,
And let my declaration fill your ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold now, I have prepared my case;
I know that I will be vindicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who could contend with me?
For then I would be silent and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Only two things I ask that You do not do to me,
Then I will not hide from Your face:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove Your hand from me,
And may the dread of You not terrify me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then call and I will answer;
Or let me speak, then reply to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are my guilty deeds and sins?
Make known to me my wrongdoing and my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You hide Your face
And consider me Your enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will You scare away a scattered leaf?
Or will You pursue the dry chaff?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You write bitter things against me
And make me inherit the guilty deeds of my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
While I am decaying like a rotten thing,
Like a garment that is moth-eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Man, who is born of woman,
Is short-lived and full of turmoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a flower he comes out and withers.
He also flees like a shadow and does not remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You also open Your eyes on him
And bring him into judgment with Yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can make the clean out of the unclean?
No one!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Look away from him so that he may rest,
Until he fulfills his day like a hired worker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For there is hope for a tree,
When it is cut down, that it will sprout again,
And its shoots will not fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though its roots grow old in the ground,
And its stump dies in the dry soil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the scent of water it will flourish
And produce sprigs like a plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But a man dies and lies prostrate.
A person passes away, and where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As water evaporates from the sea,
And a river becomes parched and dried up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So a man lies down and does not rise.
Until the heavens no longer exist,
He will not awake nor be woken from his sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh that You would hide me in Sheol,
That You would conceal me until Your wrath returns to You,
That You would set a limit for me and remember me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a man dies, will he live again?
All the days of my struggle I will wait
Until my relief comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will call, and I will answer You;
You will long for the work of Your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now You number my steps,
You do not observe my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My wrongdoing is sealed up in a bag,
And You cover over my guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But the falling mountain crumbles away,
And the rock moves from its place;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You forever overpower him and he departs;
You change his appearance and send him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sons achieve honor, but he does not know it;
Or they become insignificant, and he does not perceive it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
However, his body pains him,
And his soul mourns for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Should a wise man answer with windy knowledge,
And fill himself with the east wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should he argue with useless talk,
Or with words which do not benefit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you do away with reverence,
And hinder meditation before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your wrongdoing teaches your mouth,
And you choose the language of the cunning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your own mouth condemns you, and not I;
And your own lips testify against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Were you the first person to be born,
Or were you brought forth before the hills?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you hear the secret discussion of God,
And limit wisdom to yourself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do you know that we do not know?
What do you understand that we do not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both the gray-haired and the aged are among us,
Older than your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are the consolations of God too little for you,
Or the word spoken gently to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why does your heart take you away?
And why do your eyes wink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That you can turn your spirit against God
And produce such words from your mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is man, that he would be pure,
Or he who is born of a woman, that he would be righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He has no trust in His holy ones,
And the heavens are not pure in His sight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less one who is detestable and corrupt:
A person who drinks malice like water!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will tell you, listen to me;
And what I have seen I will also declare;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What wise people have told,
And have not concealed from their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom alone the land was given,
And no stranger passed among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked person writhes in pain all his days,
And the years reserved for the ruthless are numbered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sounds of terror are in his ears;
While he is at peace the destroyer comes upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not believe that he will return from darkness,
And he is destined for the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He wanders about for food, saying, ‘Where is it?’
He knows that a day of darkness is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Distress and anguish terrify him,
They overpower him like a king ready for the attack,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he has reached out with his hand against God,
And is arrogant toward the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rushes headlong at Him
With his massive shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has covered his face with his fat,
And put fat on his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has lived in desolate cities,
In houses no one would inhabit,
Which are destined to become ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not become rich, nor will his wealth endure;
And his property will not stretch out on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let him not trust in emptiness, deceiving himself;
For his reward will be emptiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be accomplished before his time,
And his palm branch will not be green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will drop off his unripe grape like the vine,
And will cast off his flower like the olive tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the company of the godless is barren,
And fire consumes the tents of the corrupt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They conceive harm and give birth to wrongdoing,
And their mind prepares deception.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have heard many things like these;
Miserable comforters are you all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no end to windy words?
Or what provokes you that you answer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I too could speak like you,
If only I were in your place.
I could compose words against you
And shake my head at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or I could strengthen you with my mouth,
And the condolence of my lips could lessen your pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I speak, my pain is not lessened,
And if I refrain, what pain leaves me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now He has exhausted me;
You have laid waste all my group of loved ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And You have shriveled me up,
It has become a witness;
And my infirmity rises up against me,
It testifies to my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God hands me over to criminals,
And tosses me into the hands of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He breaks through me with breach after breach;
He runs at me like a warrior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sewed sackcloth over my skin,
And thrust my horn in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My face is flushed from weeping,
And deep darkness is on my eyelids,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although there is no violence in my hands,
And my prayer is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Earth, do not cover my blood,
And may there be no resting place for my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven,
And my advocate is on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friends are my scoffers;
My eye weeps to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That one might plead for a man with God
As a son of man with his neighbor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For when a few years are past,
I shall go the way of no return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My spirit is broken, my days are extinguished,
The grave is ready for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mockers are certainly with me,
And my eye gazes on their provocation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make a pledge for me with Yourself;
Who is there that will be my guarantor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have kept their hearts away from understanding;
Therefore You will not exalt them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who informs against friends for a share of the spoils,
The eyes of his children also will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But He has made me a proverb among the people,
And I am one at whom people spit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eye has also become inexpressive because of grief,
And all my body parts are like a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright will be appalled at this,
And the innocent will stir himself up against the godless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless the righteous will hold to his way,
And the one who has clean hands will grow stronger and stronger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But come again all of you now,
For I do not find a wise man among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are past, my plans are torn apart,
The wishes of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make night into day, saying,
‘The light is near,’ in the presence of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I hope for Sheol as my home,
I make my bed in the darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I call to the grave, ‘You are my father’;
To the maggot, ‘my mother and my sister’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where then is my hope?
And who looks at my hope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will it go down with me to Sheol?
Shall we together go down into the dust?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you hunt for words?
Show understanding, and then we can talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are we regarded as animals,
As stupid in your eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who tear yourself in your anger—
Should the earth be abandoned for your sake,
Or the rock moved from its place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, the light of the wicked goes out,
And the spark from his fire does not shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light in his tent is darkened,
And his lamp goes out above him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His vigorous stride is shortened,
And his own plan brings him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he is thrown into the net by his own feet,
And he steps on the webbing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A snare seizes him by the heel,
And a trap snaps shut on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A noose for him is hidden in the ground,
And a trap for him on the pathway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All around sudden terrors frighten him,
And harass him at every step.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His strength is famished,
And disaster is ready at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It devours parts of his skin,
The firstborn of death devours his limbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is torn from the security of his tent,
And they march him before the king of terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nothing of his dwells in his tent;
Brimstone is scattered on his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His roots are dried below,
And his branch withers above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The memory of him perishes from the earth,
And he has no name abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is driven from light into darkness,
And chased from the inhabited world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has no offspring or descendants among his people,
Nor any survivor where he resided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those in the west are appalled at his fate,
And those in the east are seized with horror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly these are the dwellings of the wicked,
And this is the place of him who does not know God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you torment me
And crush me with words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These ten times you have insulted me;
You are not ashamed to wrong me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if I have truly done wrong,
My error stays with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If indeed you exalt yourselves against me
And prove my disgrace to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know then that God has wronged me
And has surrounded me with His net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I cry, ‘Violence!’ but I get no answer;
I shout for help, but there is no justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has blocked my way so that I cannot pass,
And He has put darkness on my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has stripped my honor from me
And removed the crown from my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He breaks me down on every side, and I am gone;
And He has uprooted my hope like a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has also kindled His anger against me
And considered me as His enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His troops come together
And build up their way against me
And camp around my tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has removed my brothers far from me,
And my acquaintances have completely turned away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My relatives have failed,
And my close friends have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who live in my house and my servant women consider me a stranger.
I am a foreigner in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to my servant, but he does not answer;
I have to implore his favor with my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My breath is offensive to my wife,
And I am loathsome to my own brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even young children despise me;
I stand up and they speak against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my associates loathe me,
And those I love have turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My bone clings to my skin and my flesh,
And I have escaped only by the skin of my teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pity me, pity me, you friends of mine,
For the hand of God has struck me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you persecute me as God does,
And are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh that my words were written!
Oh that they were recorded in a book!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That with an iron stylus and lead
They were engraved in the rock forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet as for me, I know that my Redeemer lives,
And at the last, He will take His stand on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even after my skin is destroyed,
Yet from my flesh I will see God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom I, on my part, shall behold for myself,
And whom my eyes will see, and not another.
My heart faints within me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you say, ‘How shall we persecute him?’
And ‘What pretext for a case against him can we find?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then be afraid of the sword for yourselves,
For wrath brings the punishment of the sword,
So that you may know there is judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar the Naamathite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore my disquieting thoughts make me respond,
Even because of my inward agitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I listened to the reprimand which insults me,
And the spirit of my understanding makes me answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know this from ancient times,
From the establishment of mankind on earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That the rejoicing of the wicked is short,
And the joy of the godless momentary?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his arrogance reaches the heavens,
And his head touches the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He perishes forever like his refuse;
Those who have seen him will say, ‘Where is he?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He flies away like a dream, and they cannot find him;
Like a vision of the night he is chased away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye which saw him sees him no longer,
And his place no longer beholds him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sons favor the poor,
And his hands give back his wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His bones are full of his youthful strength,
But it lies down with him in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Though evil tastes sweet in his mouth
And he hides it under his tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he desires it and will not let it go,
But holds it in his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet his food in his stomach is changed
To the venom of cobras within him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He sucks the poison of cobras;
The viper’s tongue kills him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not look at the streams,
The rivers flowing with honey and curds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He returns the product of his labor
And cannot swallow it;
As to the riches of his trading,
He cannot even enjoy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has oppressed and neglected the poor;
He has seized a house which he has not built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because he knew no quiet within him,
He does not retain anything he desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nothing remains for him to devour,
Therefore his prosperity does not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fullness of his excess he will be cramped;
The hand of everyone who suffers will come against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he fills his belly,
God will send His fierce anger on him
And rain it on him while he is eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He may flee from the iron weapon,
But the bronze bow will pierce him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens will reveal his guilt,
And the earth will rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The increase of his house will disappear;
His possessions will flow away on the day of His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is a wicked person’s portion from God,
The inheritance decreed to him by God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen carefully to my speech,
And let this be your way of consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bear with me that I may speak;
Then after I have spoken, you may mock me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, is my complaint to a mortal?
Or why should I not be impatient?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at me, and be astonished,
And put your hand over your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when I remember, I am disturbed,
And horror takes hold of my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the wicked still live,
Grow old, and also become very powerful?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their descendants endure with them in their sight,
And their offspring before their eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses are safe from fear,
And the rod of God is not on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His ox mates without fail;
His cow calves and does not miscarry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They send out their boys like the flock,
And their children dance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sing with the tambourine and harp,
And rejoice at the sound of the flute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spend their days in prosperity,
And suddenly they go down to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they say to God, ‘Go away from us!
We do not even desire the knowledge of Your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him,
And what would we gain if we plead with Him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, their prosperity is not in their hand;
The advice of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How often is the lamp of the wicked put out,
Or does their disaster fall on them?
Does God apportion destruction in His anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they as straw before the wind,
And like chaff which the storm carries away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You say, ‘God saves up a person’s wrongdoing for his sons.’
Let God repay him so that he may know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his own eyes see his destruction,
And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what does he care about his household after him,
When the number of his months is at an end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone teach God knowledge,
In that He judges those on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One dies in his full strength,
Being wholly undisturbed and at ease;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sides are filled with fat,
And the marrow of his bones is wet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While another dies with a bitter soul,
Never even tasting anything good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Together they lie down in the dust,
And maggots cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I know your thoughts,
And the plots you devise against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you say, ‘Where is the house of the nobleman,
And where is the tent, the dwelling places of the wicked?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not asked travelers,
And do you not examine their evidence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wicked person is spared a day of disaster;
They are led away from a day of fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who confronts him with his actions,
And who repays him for what he has done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is carried to the grave,
People will keep watch over his tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So how dare you give me empty comfort?
For your answers remain nothing but falsehood!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can a strong man be of use to God,
Or a wise one be useful to himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty if you are righteous,
Or gain if you make your ways blameless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it because of your reverence that He punishes you,
That He enters into judgment against you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your wickedness not abundant,
And is there no end to your guilty deeds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have seized pledges from your brothers without cause,
And stripped people naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given the weary no water to drink,
And you have withheld bread from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the earth belongs to the powerful man,
And the one who is honorable dwells on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have sent widows away empty,
And the strength of orphans has been crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore traps surround you,
And sudden dread terrifies you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or darkness, so that you cannot see,
And a flood of water covers you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is God not in the height of heaven?
Look also at the highest stars, how high they are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you say, ‘What does God know?
Can He judge through the thick darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds are a hiding place for Him, so that He cannot see;
And He walks on the vault of heaven.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you keep to the ancient path
Which wicked people have walked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who were snatched away before their time,
Whose foundations were washed away by a river?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to God, ‘Go away from us!’
And ‘What can the Almighty do to them?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet He filled their houses with good things;
But the advice of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous see and are glad,
And the innocent mock them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Truly our enemies are eliminated,
And fire has consumed their abundance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be reconciled with Him, and be at peace;
Thereby good will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please receive instruction from His mouth,
And put His words in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored;
If you remove injustice far from your tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And put your gold in the dust,
And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Almighty will be your gold
And abundant silver to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For then you will take pleasure in the Almighty
And lift up your face to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will pray to Him, and He will hear you;
And you will pay your vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will also decide something, and it will be established for you;
And light will shine on your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they have brought you low, you will speak with confidence,
And He will save the humble person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will rescue one who is not innocent,
And he will be rescued due to the cleanness of your hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Even today my complaint is rebellion;
His hand is heavy despite my groaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I knew how to find Him,
That I might come to His home!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would present my case before Him
And fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would learn the words which He would answer,
And perceive what He would tell me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would He contend with me by the greatness of His power?
No, surely He would pay attention to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the upright would argue with Him;
And I would be free of my Judge forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I go forward but He is not there,
And backward, but I cannot perceive Him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He acts on the left, I cannot see Him;
He turns to the right, but I cannot see Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He knows the way I take;
When He has put me to the test, I will come out as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My foot has held on to His path;
I have kept His way and not turned aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not failed the command of His lips;
I have treasured the words of His mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He is unique, and who can make Him turn?
Whatever His soul desires, He does it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He carries out what is destined for me,
And many such destinies are with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, I would be terrified at His presence;
When I consider this, I am frightened of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who has made my heart faint,
And the Almighty who has terrified me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am not destroyed by darkness,
Nor by deep gloom which covers me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why are times not stored up by the Almighty,
And why do those who know Him not see His days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People remove landmarks;
They seize and devour flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They drive away the donkeys of orphans;
They seize the widow’s ox as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They push the needy aside from the road;
The poor of the land have to hide themselves together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, like wild donkeys in the wilderness
They go out scavenging for food in their activity,
As bread for their children in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They harvest their feed in the field
And glean the vineyard of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spend the night naked, without clothing,
And have no covering against the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are wet from the mountain rains,
And they hug the rock for lack of a shelter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others snatch an orphan from the breast,
And they seize it as a pledge against the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor move about naked without clothing,
And they carry sheaves, while going hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Within the walls they produce oil;
They tread wine presses but go thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The eye of the adulterer watches for twilight,
Saying, ‘No eye will see me.’
And he disguises his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the morning is the same to him as thick darkness,
For he is familiar with the terrors of thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Dryness and heat snatch away the snow waters,
As Sheol snatches those who have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He wrongs the infertile woman,
And does no good for the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He drags off the mighty by His power;
He rises, but no one has assurance of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He provides them with security, and they are supported;
And His eyes are on their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now if it is not so, who can prove me a liar,
And make my speech worthless?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dominion and awe belong to Him
Who makes peace in His heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there any number to His troops?
And upon whom does His light not rise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How then can mankind be righteous with God?
Or how can anyone who is born of woman be pure?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If even the moon has no brightness
And the stars are not pure in His sight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less man, that maggot,
And a son of man, that worm!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job responded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What a help you are to the weak!
You have saved the arm without strength!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What advice you have given to one without wisdom!
What helpful insight you have abundantly provided!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom have you uttered words?
And whose spirit was expressed through you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The departed spirits are made to tremble
Under the waters and their inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol is naked before Him,
And Abaddon has no covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stretches out the north over empty space
And hangs the earth on nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He wraps up the waters in His clouds,
And the cloud does not burst under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He obscures the face of the full moon
And spreads His cloud over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has inscribed a circle on the surface of the waters
At the boundary of light and darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pillars of heaven tremble
And are amazed at His rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With His power He quieted the sea,
And by His understanding He shattered Rahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By His breath the heavens are cleared;
His hand has pierced the fleeing serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Job again took up his discourse and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As God lives, who has taken away my right,
And the Almighty, who has embittered my soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as long as life is in me,
And the breath of God is in my nostrils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips certainly will not speak unjustly,
Nor will my tongue mutter deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Far be it from me that I should declare you right;
Until I die, I will not give up my integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have kept hold of my righteousness and will not let it go.
My heart does not rebuke any of my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“May my enemy be as the wicked,
And my opponent as the criminal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what is the hope of the godless when he makes an end of life,
When God requires his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will God hear his cry
When distress comes upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or will he take pleasure in the Almighty?
Will he call on God at all times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will instruct you in the power of God;
What is with the Almighty I will not conceal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, all of you have seen it;
Why then do you talk of nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is the portion of a wicked person from God,
And the inheritance which tyrants receive from the Almighty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword;
And his descendants will not be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His survivors will be buried because of the plague,
And their widows will not be able to weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he piles up silver like dust,
And prepares garments as plentiful as the clay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He may prepare it, but the righteous will wear it
And the innocent will divide the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has built his house like the spider’s web,
Or a hut which the watchman has made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lies down rich, but never again;
He opens his eyes, and it no longer exists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Terrors overtake him like a flood;
A storm steals him away in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The east wind carries him away, and he is gone;
For it sweeps him away from his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it will hurl at him without mercy;
He will certainly try to flee from its power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People will clap their hands at him,
And will whistle at him from their places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Certainly there is a mine for silver
And a place for refining gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iron is taken from the dust,
And copper is smelted from rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man puts an end to darkness,
And to the farthest limit he searches out
The rock in gloom and deep shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
From the earth comes food,
And underneath, it is turned over like fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its rocks are the source of sapphires,
And its dust contains gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No bird of prey knows the path,
Nor has the falcon’s eye caught sight of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud animals have not trodden it,
Nor has the lion passed over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He puts his hand on the flint;
He overturns the mountains at the base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He carves out channels through the rocks,
And his eye sees anything precious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dams up the streams from flowing,
And brings to light what is hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But where can wisdom be found?
And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mankind does not know its value,
Nor is it found in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ocean depth says, ‘It is not in me’;
And the sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pure gold cannot be given in exchange for it,
Nor can silver be weighed as its price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir,
In precious onyx, or sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gold or glass cannot equal it,
Nor can it be exchanged for articles of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Coral and crystal are not to be mentioned;
And the acquisition of wisdom is more valuable than pearls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The topaz of Cush cannot equal it,
Nor can it be valued in pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where then does wisdom come from?
And where is this place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is hidden from the eyes of every living creature,
And concealed from the birds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abaddon and Death say,
‘With our ears we have heard a report of it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“God understands its way,
And He knows its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He looks to the ends of the earth;
He sees everything under the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He imparted weight to the wind,
And assessed the waters by measure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He made a limit for the rain,
And a course for the thunderbolt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He saw it and declared it;
He established it and also searched it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And to mankind He said, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom;
And to turn away from evil is understanding.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job again took up his discourse and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh that I were as in months gone by,
As in the days when God watched over me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When His lamp shone over my head,
And by His light I walked through darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as I was in the days of my youth,
When the protection of God was over my tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty was still with me,
And my children were around me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my steps were bathed in cream,
And the rock poured out streams of oil for me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I went out to the gate of the city,
When I took my seat in the public square,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young men saw me and hid themselves,
And the old men arose and stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The leaders stopped talking
And put their hands on their mouths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voices of the prominent people were hushed,
And their tongues stuck to their palates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For when an ear heard, it called me blessed,
And when an eye saw, it testified in support of me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I saved the poor who cried for help,
And the orphan who had no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the one who was about to perish came upon me,
And I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;
My justice was like a robe and a headband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was eyes to those who were blind,
And feet to those who could not walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was a father to the poor,
And I investigated the case which I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I broke the jaws of the wicked
And rescued the prey from his teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I thought, ‘I will die with my family,
And I will multiply my days as the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My root is spread out to the waters,
And dew lies on my branch all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My glory is ever new with me,
And my bow is renewed in my hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To me they listened and waited,
And they kept silent for my advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After my words they did not speak again,
And my speech dropped on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They waited for me as for the rain,
And opened their mouths as for the late rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I smiled at them when they did not believe,
And they did not look at my kindness ungraciously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
