I chose a way for them and sat as chief,
And lived as a king among the troops,
As one who comforted the mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But now those who are younger than I mock me,
Whose fathers I refused to put with the dogs of my flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, what good was the strength of their hands to me?
Vigor had perished from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From poverty and famine they are gaunt,
They who gnaw at the dry ground by night in waste and desolation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who pluck saltweed by the bushes,
And whose food is the root of the broom shrub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are driven from the community;
They shout against them as against a thief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that they live on the slopes of ravines,
In holes in the ground and among the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the bushes they cry out;
Under the weeds they are gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worthless fellows, even those without a name,
They were cast out from the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now I have become their taunt,
And I have become a byword to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They loathe me and stand aloof from me,
And they do not refrain from spitting in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because He has undone my bowstring and afflicted me,
They have cast off the bridle before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the right hand their mob arises;
They push aside my feet and pile up their ways of destruction against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As through a wide gap they come,
Amid the storm they roll on.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And now my soul is poured out within me;
Days of misery have seized me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At night it pierces my bones within me,
And my gnawing pains do not rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By a great force my garment is distorted;
It ties me up like the collar of my coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has thrown me into the mire,
And I have become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer me;
I stand up, and You turn Your attention against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have become cruel to me;
With the strength of Your hand You persecute me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You lift me up to the wind and make me ride it;
And You dissolve me in a storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that You will bring me to death,
And to the house of meeting for all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet does one in a heap of ruins not reach out with his hand,
Or in his disaster does he not cry out for help?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not wept for the one whose life is hard?
Was my soul not grieved for the needy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I expected good, evil came;
When I waited for light, darkness came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am seething within and cannot rest;
Days of misery confront me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I go about mourning without comfort;
I stand up in the assembly and cry out for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a brother to jackals,
And a companion of ostriches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My skin turns black on me,
And my bones burn with fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my harp is turned to mourning,
And my flute to the sound of those who weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have made a covenant with my eyes;
How then could I look at a virgin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And what is the portion of God from above,
Or the inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not disaster to the criminal,
And misfortune to those who practice injustice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does He not see my ways,
And count all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have walked with deception,
And my foot has hurried after deceit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Him weigh me with accurate scales,
And let God know my integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If my step has turned from the way,
Or my heart followed my eyes,
Or if any spot has stuck to my hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me sow and another eat,
And let my crops be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If my heart has been enticed by a woman,
Or I have lurked at my neighbor’s doorway,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my wife grind grain for another,
And let others kneel down over her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that would be a lustful crime;
Moreover, it would be wrongdoing punishable by judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it would be fire that consumes to Abaddon,
And would uproot all my increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have rejected the claim of my male or female slaves
When they filed a complaint against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What then could I do when God arises?
And when He calls me to account, how am I to answer Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did He who made me in the womb not make him,
And the same one create us in the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have kept the poor from their desire,
Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or have eaten my morsel alone,
And the orphan has not shared it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(But from my youth he grew up with me as with a father,
And from my infancy I guided her),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing,
Or that the needy had no covering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his waist has not thanked me,
And if he has not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have lifted up my hand against the orphan,
Because I saw I had support in the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my shoulder fall from its socket,
And my arm be broken off at the elbow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For disaster from God is a terror to me,
And because of His majesty I can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have put my confidence in gold,
And called fine gold my trust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have gloated because my wealth was great,
And because my hand had obtained so much;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have looked at the sun when it shone,
Or the moon going in splendor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And my heart was secretly enticed,
And my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That too would have been a guilty deed calling for judgment,
For I would have denied God above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have I rejoiced at the misfortune of my enemy,
Or become excited when evil found him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, I have not allowed my mouth to sin
By asking for his life in a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have the people of my tent not said,
‘Who can find one who has not been satisfied with his meat’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stranger has not spent the night outside,
For I have opened my doors to the traveler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I covered my wrongdoings like a man,
By hiding my guilt in my shirt pocket,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I feared the great multitude
And the contempt of families terrified me,
And I kept silent and did not go out of doors?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I had one to hear me!
Here is my signature;
Let the Almighty answer me!
And the indictment which my adversary has written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would certainly carry it on my shoulder,
I would tie it to myself like a garland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would declare to Him the number of my steps;
Like a prince, I would approach Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If my land cries out against me,
And its furrows weep together;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have eaten its fruit without money,
Or have caused its owners to lose their lives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the thorn-bush grow instead of wheat,
And stinkweed instead of barley.”
The words of Job are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the anger of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, burned against Job; his anger burned because he justified himself before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his anger burned against his three friends because they had found no answer, yet they had condemned Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because they were years older than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men, his anger burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I thought age should speak,
And increased years should teach wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is a spirit that is in mankind,
And the breath of the Almighty gives them understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The abundant in years may not be wise,
Nor may elders understand justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I say, ‘Listen to me,
I too will tell what I think.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I waited for your words,
I listened to your skillful speech,
While you pondered what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So do not say,
‘We have found wisdom:
God will defeat him, not man.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he has not presented his words against me,
Nor will I reply to him with your arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They are dismayed, they no longer answer;
Words have failed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I wait, because they are not speaking,
Because they have stopped and no longer answer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I too will give my share of answers;
I also will tell my opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am full of words;
The spirit within me compels me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, my belly is like unvented wine;
Like new wineskins, it is about to burst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me speak so that I may get relief;
Let me open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me be partial to no one,
Nor flatter any man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I do not know how to flatter,
Otherwise my Maker would quickly take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“However, please hear my speech, Job,
And listen to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold now, I open my mouth,
My tongue in my mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My words are from the integrity of my heart,
And my lips speak knowledge sincerely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of God has made me,
And the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Refute me if you can;
Line up against me, take your stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I belong to God, like you;
I too have been formed out of the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, no fear of me should terrify you,
Nor should my pressure weigh heavily on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have in fact spoken while I listened,
And I heard the sound of your words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I am pure, without wrongdoing;
I am innocent and there is no guilt in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He invents criticisms against me;
He counts me as His enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He puts my feet in the stocks;
He watches all my paths.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, let me respond to you, you are not right in this,
For God is greater than mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why do you complain to Him
That He does not give an account of all His doings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed God speaks once,
Or twice, yet no one notices it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a dream, a vision of the night,
When deep sleep falls on people,
While they slumber in their beds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He opens the ears of people,
And horrifies them with warnings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that He may turn a person away from bad conduct,
And keep a man from pride;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He keeps his soul back from the pit,
And his life from perishing by the spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A person is also rebuked by pain in his bed,
And with constant complaint in his bones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that his life loathes bread,
And his soul, food that he should crave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His flesh wastes away from sight,
And his bones, which were not seen, stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then his soul comes near to the pit,
And his life to those who bring death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If there is an interceding angel for him,
One out of a thousand,
To remind a person of what is right for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let his flesh become fresher than in youth,
Let him return to the days of his youthful vigor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will pray to God, and He will accept him,
So that he may see His face with joy,
And He will restore His righteousness to that person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will sing to people and say,
‘I have sinned and perverted what is right,
And it is not proper for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has redeemed my soul from going to the pit,
And my life will see the light.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, God does all these things for a man two or three times,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To bring back his soul from the pit,
So that he may be enlightened with the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention, Job, listen to me;
Keep silent, and let me speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then if you have anything to say, answer me;
Speak, for I would take pleasure in justifying you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If not, listen to me;
Keep silent, and I will teach you wisdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu continued and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear my words, you wise men,
And listen to me, you who understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ear tests words
As the palate tastes food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us choose for ourselves what is right;
Let us understand among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Job has said, ‘I am righteous,
But God has taken away my right;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I lie about my right?
My wound is incurable, though I am without wrongdoing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What man is like Job,
Who drinks up derision like water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who goes in company with the workers of injustice,
And walks with wicked people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has said, ‘It is of no use to a man
When he becomes friends with God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, listen to me, you men of understanding.
Far be it from God to do evil,
And from the Almighty to do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He repays a person for his work,
And lets things happen in correspondence to a man’s behavior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God certainly will not act wickedly,
And the Almighty will not pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who gave Him authority over the earth?
And who has placed the whole world on Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If He were to determine to do so,
If He were to gather His spirit and His breath to Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Humanity would perish together,
And mankind would return to dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But if you have understanding, hear this;
Listen to the sound of my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall one who hates justice rule?
And will you condemn the righteous mighty One,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who says to a king, ‘You worthless one,’
To nobles, ‘You wicked one’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who shows no partiality to the prominent,
Nor regards the rich as above the poor,
Since they are all the work of His hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a moment they die, and at midnight
People are shaken and pass away,
And the powerful are taken away without a hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For His eyes are upon the ways of a person,
And He sees all his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no darkness or deep shadow
Where the workers of injustice can hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He does not need to consider a person further,
That he should go before God in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He breaks in pieces the mighty without investigation,
And sets others in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore He knows their deeds,
And He overthrows them in the night,
And they are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He strikes them like the wicked
In a public place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they turned aside from following Him,
And had no regard for any of His ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that they caused the cry of the poor to come to Him,
And that He would hear the cry of the afflicted—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He keeps quiet, who can condemn?
And when He hides His face, who then can look at Him,
That is, regarding both nation and a person?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that godless people would not rule,
Nor be snares for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Men of understanding will say to me,
And a wise man who hears me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Job speaks without knowledge,
And his words are without wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that Job were tested to the limit,
Because he answers like sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu continued and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you think this is in accordance with justice?
Do you say, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you say, ‘What advantage will it be to You?
What benefit will I have, more than if I had sinned?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will answer you,
And your friends with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at the heavens and see;
And look at the clouds—they are higher than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have sinned, what do you accomplish against Him?
And if your wrongdoings are many, what do you do to Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are righteous, what do you give to Him,
Or what does He receive from your hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness is for a man like yourself,
And your righteousness is for a son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because of the multitude of oppressions they cry out;
They cry for help because of the arm of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker,
Who gives songs in the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who teaches us more than the animals of the earth
And makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they cry out, but He does not answer
Because of the pride of evil people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God certainly will not listen to an empty cry,
Nor will the Almighty regard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less when you say you do not look at Him,
The case is before Him, and you must wait for Him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now, because He has not avenged His anger,
Nor has He acknowledged wrongdoing well,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Job opens his mouth with empty words;
He multiplies words without knowledge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu continued and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wait for me a little, and I will show you
That there is still more to be said on God’s behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring my knowledge from afar,
And ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For truly my words are not false;
One who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is mighty but does not reject anyone;
He is mighty in strength of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not keep the wicked alive,
But gives justice to the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous,
But with kings on the throne
He has seated them forever, and they are exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if they are bound in shackles,
And are caught in the snares of misery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He declares to them their work
And their wrongdoings, that they have been arrogant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opens their ears to instruction,
And commands that they return from injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they listen and serve Him,
They will end their days in prosperity,
And their years in happiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they do not listen, they will perish by the sword,
And die without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the godless in heart nurture anger;
They do not call for help when He binds them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They die in youth,
And their life perishes among the cult prostitutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rescues the afflicted in their misery,
And opens their ears in time of oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“But you were full of judgment on the wicked;
Judgment and justice take hold of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beware that wrath does not entice you to mockery;
And do not let the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will your cry for help keep you from distress,
Or all the exertions of your strength?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not long for the night,
When people vanish in their places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be careful, do not turn to evil,
For you preferred this to misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is exalted in His power;
Who is a teacher like Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has appointed Him His way,
And who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Remember that you are to exalt His work,
Of which people have sung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All people have seen it;
Mankind looks at it from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is exalted, and we do not know Him;
The number of His years is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He draws up the drops of water;
They distill rain from its celestial stream,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which clouds pour down;
They drip upon mankind abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone understand the spreading of the clouds,
The thundering of His pavilion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He spreads His lightning about Him,
And He covers the depths of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by them He judges peoples;
He gives food in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covers His hands with the lightning,
And commands it to strike the target.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its thundering voice declares His presence;
The livestock also, concerning what is coming up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“At this also my heart trembles,
And leaps from its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen closely to the thunder of His voice,
And the rumbling that goes out from His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Under the whole heaven He lets it loose,
And His lightning travels to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God thunders wondrously with His voice,
Doing great things which we do not comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For to the snow He says, ‘Fall on the earth,’
And to the downpour and the rain, ‘Be strong.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He seals the hand of every person,
So that all people may know His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the animal goes into its lair
And remains in its den.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the south comes the storm,
And from the north wind the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the breath of God ice is made,
And the expanse of the waters is frozen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also loads the clouds with moisture;
He disperses the cloud of His lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It changes direction, turning around by His guidance,
That it may do whatever He commands it
On the face of the inhabited earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whether for correction, or for His earth,
Or for goodness, He causes it to happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to this, Job;
Stand and consider the wonders of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know how God establishes them,
And makes the lightning of His clouds to shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know about the hovering of the clouds,
The wonders of One who is perfect in knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You whose garments are hot
When the land is still because of the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you, with Him, spread out the skies,
Strong as a cast metal mirror?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach us what we are to say to Him;
We cannot present our case because of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall it be told Him that I would speak?
Or should a man say that he would be swallowed up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now people do not see the light which is bright in the skies;
But the wind has passed and cleared them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the north comes golden splendor;
Around God is awesome majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore people fear Him;
He does not regard any who are wise of heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job from the whirlwind and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who is this who darkens the divine plan
By words without knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now tighten the belt on your waist like a man,
And I shall ask you, and you inform Me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth?
Tell Me, if you have understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who set its measurements? Since you know.
Or who stretched the measuring line over it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On what were its bases sunk?
Or who laid its cornerstone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the morning stars sang together
And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Or who enclosed the sea with doors
When it went out from the womb, bursting forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I made a cloud its garment,
And thick darkness its swaddling bands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I placed boundaries on it
And set a bolt and doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, ‘As far as this point you shall come, but no farther;
And here your proud waves shall stop’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you ever in your life commanded the morning,
And made the dawn know its place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that it would take hold of the ends of the earth,
And the wicked would be shaken off from it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is changed like clay under the seal;
And they stand out like a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their light is withheld from the wicked,
And the uplifted arm is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you entered the springs of the sea,
And walked in the depth of the ocean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have the gates of death been revealed to you,
And have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you understood the expanse of the earth?
Tell Me, if you know all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where is the way to the dwelling of light?
And darkness, where is its place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That you would take it to its territory,
And discern the paths to its home?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know, for you were born then,
And the number of your days is great!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you entered the storehouses of the snow,
And have you seen the storehouses of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which I have reserved for a time of distress,
For a day of war and battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where is the way that the light is divided,
And the east wind scattered on the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who has split open a channel for the flood,
And a way for the thunderbolt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To bring rain on a land without people,
On a desert without a person in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To satisfy the waste and desolate land,
And to make the seeds of grass to sprout?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the rain have a father?
Or who has fathered the drops of dew?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From whose womb has come the ice?
And the frost of heaven, who has given it birth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Water becomes hard like stone,
And the surface of the deep is imprisoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you tie up the chains of the Pleiades,
Or untie the cords of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you bring out a constellation in its season,
And guide the Bear with her satellites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know the ordinances of the heavens,
Or do you establish their rule over the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you raise your voice to the clouds,
So that an abundance of water will cover you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you send flashes of lightning, so that they may go
And say to you, ‘Here we are’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has put wisdom in the innermost being,
Or given understanding to the mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can count the clouds by wisdom,
And pour out the water jars of the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the dust hardens into a mass
And the clods stick together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you hunt the prey for the lioness,
Or satisfy the appetite of young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they crouch in their hiding places,
And lie in wait in their lair?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who prepares feed for the raven
When its young cry to God,
And wander about without food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you know the time the mountain goats give birth?
Do you observe the calving of the deer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you count the months they fulfill,
Or do you know the time they give birth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They kneel down, they deliver their young,
They get rid of their labor pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their offspring become strong, they grow up in the open field;
They leave and do not return to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who sent the wild donkey out free?
And who opened the bonds of the swift donkey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom I gave the wilderness as his home,
And the salt land as his dwelling place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He laughs at the turmoil of the city,
He does not hear the shouting of the taskmaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He explores the mountains of his pasture,
And searches after every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the wild bull be willing to serve you,
Or will he spend the night at your feeding trough?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you tie down the wild bull in a furrow with ropes,
Or will he plow the valleys after you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you trust him because his strength is great,
And leave your labor to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you have faith in him that he will return your grain
And gather it from your threshing floor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The wings of the ostrich flap joyously,
With the pinion and feathers of love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she abandons her eggs to the earth
And warms them in the dust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And she forgets that a foot may crush them,
Or that a wild animal may trample them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She treats her young cruelly, as if they were not hers;
Though her labor is for nothing, she is unconcerned,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because God has made her forget wisdom,
And has not given her a share of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When she rushes away on high,
She laughs at the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you give the horse his might?
Do you clothe his neck with a mane?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you make him leap like locusts?
His majestic snorting is frightening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength;
He goes out to meet the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He laughs at fear and is not dismayed;
And he does not turn back from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The quiver rattles against him,
The flashing spear and javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He races over the ground with a roar and fury,
And he does not stand still when he hears the sound of the trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As often as the trumpet sounds he says, ‘Aha!’
And he senses the battle from afar,
And the thunder of the captains and the war cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is it by your understanding that the hawk soars,
Stretching his wings toward the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it at your command that the eagle flies high,
And makes his nest on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dwells and spends his nights on the cliff,
On the rocky cliff, an inaccessible place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From there he tracks food;
His eyes look at it from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His young ones also lick up blood greedily;
And where the slain are, there he is.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Job,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will the faultfinder contend with the Almighty?
Let him who rebukes God give an answer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am insignificant; what can I say in response to You?
I put my hand on my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have spoken once, and I will not reply;
Or twice, and I will add nothing more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job from the whirlwind and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now tighten the belt on your waist like a man;
I will ask you, and you instruct Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you really nullify My judgment?
Will you condemn Me so that you may be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or do you have an arm like God,
And can you thunder with a voice like His?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Adorn yourself with pride and dignity,
And clothe yourself with honor and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let out your outbursts of anger,
And look at everyone who is arrogant, and humble him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at everyone who is arrogant, and humble him,
And trample down the wicked where they stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide them together in the dust;
Imprison them in the hidden place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will also confess to you,
That your own right hand can save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, Behemoth, which I made as well as you;
He eats grass like an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, his strength in his waist,
And his power in the muscles of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hangs his tail like a cedar;
The tendons of his thighs are knit together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His bones are tubes of bronze;
His limbs are like bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He is the first of the ways of God;
Let his Maker bring His sword near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed the mountains bring him food,
And all the animals of the field play there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lies down under the lotus plants,
In the hiding place of the reeds and the marsh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lotus plants cover him with shade;
The willows of the brook surround him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a river rages, he is not alarmed;
He is confident, though the Jordan rushes to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone capture him when he is on watch,
Can anyone pierce his nose with barbs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you drag out Leviathan with a fishhook,
And press down his tongue with a rope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you put a rope in his nose,
And pierce his jaw with a hook?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make many pleas to you,
Or will he speak to you gentle words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make a covenant with you?
Will you take him as a servant forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you play with him as with a bird,
And tie him down for your young girls?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the traders bargain for him?
Will they divide him among the merchants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you fill his skin with harpoons,
Or his head with fishing spears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lay your hand on him.
Remember the battle; you will not do it again!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, your expectation is false;
Will you be hurled down even at the sight of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one is so reckless that he dares to stir him;
Who then is he who opposes Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has been first to give to Me, that I should repay him?
Whatever is under the entire heaven is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not be silent about his limbs,
Or his mighty strength, or his graceful frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can strip off his outer covering?
Who can pierce his double armor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can open the doors of his face?
Around his teeth there is terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His strong scales are his pride,
Locked as with a tight seal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One is so close to another
That no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are joined one to another;
They clasp each other and cannot be separated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sneezes flash forth light,
And his eyes are like the eye of dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From his mouth go burning torches;
Sparks of fire leap forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From his nostrils smoke goes out
As from a boiling pot and burning reeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath sets coals aglow,
And a flame goes forth from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his neck dwells strength,
And dismay leaps before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The folds of his flesh are joined together,
Firm and immovable on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His heart is as firm as a stone,
And as firm as a lower millstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he rises up, the mighty are afraid;
Because of the crashing they are bewildered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sword that reaches him cannot prevail,
Nor the spear, the dart, or the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He regards iron as straw,
Bronze as rotten wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrow cannot make him flee;
Slingstones are turned into stubble for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clubs are regarded as stubble;
He laughs at the rattling of the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His underparts are like sharp pieces of pottery;
He spreads out like a threshing sledge on the mud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes the depths boil like a pot;
He makes the sea like a jar of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behind him he illuminates a pathway;
One would think the deep to be gray-haired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nothing on earth is like him,
One made without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looks on everything that is high;
He is king over all the sons of pride.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I know that You can do all things,
And that no plan is impossible for You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Who is this who conceals advice without knowledge?’
Therefore I have declared that which I did not understand,
Things too wonderful for me, which I do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Please listen, and I will speak;
I will ask You, and You instruct me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard of You by the hearing of the ear;
But now my eye sees You;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I retract,
And I repent, sitting on dust and ashes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about after the Lord had spoken these words to Job, that the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “My wrath is kindled against you and against your two friends, because you have not spoken of Me what is trustworthy, as My servant Job has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, take for yourselves seven bulls and seven rams, and go to My servant Job, and offer up a burnt offering for yourselves, and My servant Job will pray for you. For I will accept him so as not to do with you as your foolishness deserves, because you have not spoken of Me what is trustworthy, as My servant Job has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the Lord told them; and the Lord accepted Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also restored the fortunes of Job when he prayed for his friends, and the Lord increased double all that Job had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all his brothers, all his sisters, and all who had known him before came to him, and they ate bread with him in his house; and they sympathized with him and comforted him for all the adversities that the Lord had brought on him. And each one gave him a piece of money, and each a ring of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord blessed the latter days of Job more than his beginning; and he had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand female donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also had seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He named the first Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all the land no women were found as beautiful as Job’s daughters; and their father gave them inheritances among their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Job lived 140 years, and saw his sons and his grandsons, four generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job died, an old man and full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
